page.title: 07A DAIRY FARMER'S DAY
page.content: Arise at 5.30 to fetch the cows in to start{milking}by 6.0. There are sixty-five animals to milk and the dairy to clean by 8.15, then feed the calves and go for breakfast. In{winter the cows are all housed and fed on silage - they must be bedded up and cleaned out. In{summer}they go out to graze. In{spring}the main tasks between milkings are preparing the land for growing sileage and hay, i.e. rolling, harrowing and fertilizing if second and third crops of sileage are to be taken.{Afternoon milking}begins at 4.0 and should be finished by about 6.0. Any electric fences to be moved can be done in the{evening}ready for the cows to strip-graze the following day.
